criteria.name: Text Preprocessing and Feature Extraction
criteria.description: Effectiveness of techniques used for cleaning, normalizing, and representing the medical text data (e.g., tokenization, stop word removal, stemming/lemmatization, TF-IDF, Word Embeddings).

grading_scale.description: Demonstrates sophisticated text preprocessing techniques, resulting in a clean and informative feature set, well-justified choices for each step.
Implements common text preprocessing techniques, producing a reasonably clean feature set with a rationale provided.
Applies basic text preprocessing but may miss opportunities for improvement, resulting in a somewhat noisy feature set. Rationale is weak or missing.
Minimal or ineffective text preprocessing, leading to a poorly represented feature set.  No justification provided.

criteria.name: Classification Model Development
criteria.description: Appropriateness and performance of the classification model(s) selected and trained on the medical text data, including model selection, hyperparameter tuning, and handling imbalanced data.

grading_scale.description: Selects and implements an appropriate classification model, employs effective hyperparameter tuning, and addresses the imbalanced dataset issue with suitable techniques (e.g., class weighting, oversampling, undersampling).  Demonstrates high performance.
Chooses a suitable classification model, performs some hyperparameter tuning, and attempts to address the imbalanced data challenge, but improvements are possible.
Selects a basic classification model with limited or no hyperparameter tuning, and does not adequately address the imbalanced data problem.  Performance is mediocre.
Selects an inappropriate classification model, performs no hyperparameter tuning, and ignores the imbalanced data issue.  Very poor performance.

criteria.name: Code Quality and Execution
criteria.description: Clarity, readability, and efficiency of the submitted code. Ability to execute the code and reproduce the results.

grading_scale.description: Code is well-documented, easy to understand, and executes without errors.  Results are easily reproducible.
Code is mostly readable and executes with minimal errors.  Results are reproducible with some effort.
Code is difficult to understand and/or executes with errors. Reproducing results requires significant effort or debugging.
Code is unreadable, does not execute, or does not produce the required output.  Results are not reproducible.

criteria.name: Clarity and Completeness
criteria.description: The report is well-written, organized, and covers all required aspects: name, SJSU ID, rank & F1-score, approach, methodology, and special instructions.

grading_scale.description: Report is exceptionally clear, concise, and covers all required information in a well-organized manner.  Demonstrates a strong understanding of the project.
Report is generally clear and covers most of the required information, though some areas may lack detail or clarity.
Report is somewhat unclear, missing key information, or poorly organized.
Report is unreadable, incomplete, or fails to address the required topics.

criteria.name: Justification and Explanation
criteria.description: Provides a clear and well-reasoned justification for the chosen approach and parameters, demonstrating a strong understanding of the underlying concepts.

grading_scale.description: Provides a compelling and insightful justification for all key decisions, demonstrating a deep understanding of the trade-offs involved.
Offers a reasonable justification for the chosen approach and parameters, but may lack depth or critical analysis.
Provides a superficial or weak justification for the chosen approach and parameters, with limited evidence of understanding.
Fails to provide a meaningful justification for the chosen approach and parameters, demonstrating a lack of understanding.

criteria.name: Submission Frequency & Adherence to Rules
criteria.description: Adherence to the submission rules (5 submissions per day max). This component is assessed as a binary condition: Compliance or Non-Compliance. Submitting less than 5 times is fine.

grading_scale.description: Complied with all submission rules. Submitted output and code on leaderboard website correctly. Output matched submitted code.
Did not comply with the submission rules. Submitted output and code on leaderboard website were incorrect. Output did not match submitted code.
